meanings.sent1: I will rephotograph the sunset tomorrow to get a better picture.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rephotograph the old family portrait for a school project.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally deleted the first picture, so I had to rephotograph it.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to rephotograph the landscape to capture the changing light.
meanings.sent5: He had to rephotograph the document because it was blurry the first time.

meanings.sent1: The rephotograph of the group was clearer than the original.
meanings.sent2: She kept a rephotograph of her childhood home on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The rephotograph of the cat made it look like it had two heads.
meanings.sent4: The rephotograph of the flower highlighted its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: He cherished the rephotograph of his grandparents on their wedding day.
